org.mundo.rt
Class Signal

java.lang.Object
  org.mundo.rt.Signal

public abstract class Signal
extends java.lang.Object

This utility class offers various methods to connect message sources to message consumers.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler, Andreas Hartl

Method Detail

connect

public static void connect(Subscriber sub,
                           java.lang.Object obj)
Connects a subscriber to a server object. This method exports an object. Remote parties can use the channel associated with the subscriber to issue remote method calls to the specified server object.

Parameters:
sub - the subscriber object.
obj - the server object to export. If obj is a client stub, the associated local object is used.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if a client stub is passed and the associated object is not local.

connect

public static void connect(DoObject stub,
                           Publisher pub)
Connects a client stub to a publisher. After connecting, the client stub can be used to issue remote method calls over the channel.

Parameters:
stub - the client stub.
pub - the publisher object.

connect

public static void connect(IEmits emitter,
                           Publisher pub)

disconnect

public static void disconnect(DoObject stub)
Disconnects a client stub from its publisher and unadvertises the publisher.

Parameters:
stub - the client stub.

connectStrict

public static void connectStrict(DoObject stub,
                                 Publisher pub)
                          throws RMCException

Connects a client stub to a publisher and defines strict, traditional Client/Server interaction. This means that the server object must already be connected at the other end and export an interface compatible to the specified DoObject. If this method returns without throwing an exception, it is guaranteed that following RMC calls will succeed as long as the server remains reachable (and there are no version conflicts between server and client stubs).

This operation verifies that

  • the specified publisher is relevant, i.e. a subscriber is listening on the same channel.
  • an ObjectAdapter is connected to the subscriber.
  • a suitable server stub exists and can be instantiated.
  • the interface implemented by the client stub is available on the server side.
  • the target object exists.
  • the server stub is compatible with the target object.

Parameters:
stub - the client stub.
pub - the publisher object.
Throws:
RMCException - if the connect operation was not successful.

getIfSubscribers

public static java.lang.Object[] getIfSubscribers(java.lang.Class ifc)
Returns the subscribers to the specified interface. Called by the emit stubs generated by mcc.

Returns:
An array holding the event targets. null if empty.

getTargets

public static java.lang.Object[] getTargets(java.lang.Class ifc,

connect

public static void connect(java.lang.Class iface,
                           IEmits src,
                           java.lang.Object target)
                    throws SignalMismatchException
Connects the slots of a target object to the signal interface of a source object. Only the events of one signal interface are connected. Therefore, if an object emits events of more than one signal interface, one must register the target object seperately for each signal interface.

Parameters:
iface - The signal interface class in which the target object is interested in
src - The source object emitting the events
target - The target object receiving the events
Throws:
SignalMismatchException - If either the source object does not emit the given signal interface or if the target interface does not implement the signal interface

connect

public static void connect(java.lang.String nspc,
                           java.lang.Class iface,
                           java.lang.Object target)
Under construction. Connects all objects emitting the specified signal interface with the specified slot object. Currently, this only works locally.

Parameters:
nspc - Must be "rt".
iface - The signal interface.
target - The slot object.

disconnect

public static void disconnect(java.lang.Class iface,
                              java.lang.Object target)
